data.title: Troup Places & People
data.meta_description: Troup Places: (site of) Castle Troup, Aberdeenshire. Destroyed by Robert the Bruce in 1307/8   Troup People Sir George Alexander Troup (1863 -1941) George Troup was a New Zealand architect, engineer and statesman. Born in London to Scottish parents, they moved back to Edinburgh shortly after his birth. Troup was educat
data.text:
ScotClans is a family run business based in Leith, Edinburgh in Sunny (sometimes) Scotland. The business was started by Rodger and Amanda Moffet and is ably assisted by Rowan and Harvey and Floyd the dog. Rodger is a published author on clan histories and Amanda is a fully trained Kilt-maker.

ScotClans fully supports the clan heritage industry and has many close connections with clan and Scottish societies worldwide as well as Visit Scotland.

Supporting ScotClans means that you are supporting the wider clan network as much of our time goes into working with societies and improving the quality of information on the clans
